DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all summary counters displayed on page load
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Observe summary counter section
EXPECTED RESULT: Four summary counters are displayed: Total, Open, Completed, and Rejected. Each shows a numerical value.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see all counters accurately reflect the number of cases for each status
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Apply a filter
3. Note all counter values (Total, Open, Completed, Rejected)
4. Count cases in the case table for each status
5. Compare counter values with actual counts
EXPECTED RESULT: Each counter accurately matches the number of cases in the filtered results: Total reflects all filtered cases, Open reflects filtered cases with Open status, Completed reflects filtered cases with Completed status, and Rejected reflects filtered cases with Rejected status.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can verify that status counters sum equals the Total counter
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Note all counter values
3. Add Open + Completed + Rejected
EXPECTED RESULT: The sum of Open, Completed, and Rejected counters equals the Total counter (accounting for any other statuses if applicable).

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters display zero when no cases exist for a status
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Identify any counter showing 0
3. Verify no cases in the table have that status
EXPECTED RESULT: Counter displays 0 when no cases have that status. Display is clear and readable.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters are clearly formatted and readable
TEST STEPS:
1. Navigate to Case Management page
2. Review counter display formatting
EXPECTED RESULT: Each counter displays a large number above a status label. Spacing and typography are consistent. Counters are visually distinct from each other.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters update when a new case is created
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Click "Create New Case" button
3. Complete case creation with a specific status
4. Return to case list
5. Observe counter values
EXPECTED RESULT: Total counter increases by 1. The relevant status counter (e.g., Open) also increases by 1. Other counters remain unchanged.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see counters update when a case status changes
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Open a case with Status = "Open"
3. Change status to "Completed"
4. Save and return to case list
EXPECTED RESULT: Open counter decreases by 1. Completed counter increases by 1. Total counter remains unchanged.

DESCRIPTION: As a user I can see accurate counter values after refreshing the page
TEST STEPS:
1. Note current counter values
2. Refresh the page (F5 or browser refresh)
3. Observe counter values after page reload
EXPECTED RESULT: Counter values remain accurate and consistent with the cases in the database.
